Words of Wisdom. As most people do, you can pair this up with the Nan Liang Garden as both are connected. Take the green MTR line to Diamond Hill and take the C2 exit, following the signs to the garden. Walk through the garden and into the front of the temple area. You can take photos from the outside garden portion but not once you step through the gate, so be respectful of that. One of my favorite parts, aside from the peacefulness, was a rock exhibit that spanned the length of the eastern wall. Under each rock was a quote that was either inspiring or made you think. Give yourself over an hour to explore this place and the neighboring garden, just make sure the weather is nice.

Peaceful surrounds. Quiet courtyard with time to reflect on life. Several Buddha's. If you are lucky the nuns will be chanting. Was challenging to keep a 3 year old quiet but no one seemed to mind him asking questions.
Serene and Beautiful. A peaceful morning walk/sightseeing from the bustling city. Worth a 2-hours visit. Alight at Diamond Hill Station.
beautiful lilies. Loved the garden. And many of the sayings posted under the stones in the stone collection. The staff however was quite and surprisingly unfriendly.

Peaceful. Definitely worth a visit, probably the most peaceful place I visited in Hong Kong. Wonderful statues and courtyard with ponds. There's a large exhibit of special rocks. The Nan Lian Garden is next door. A short walk from the Diamond Hill MTR station.
Good place to visit paired with Nan Lian Garden. Calm, serene place to visit in HK. Best way to get there would be the bus or MTR to Diamond Hill station.

Another lovely serene place,beautifully done,gardens ,bonsais,staues,. A realy beautifully done place,make one feel calm and peaceful. Unfortunately it rained that day. But a lovely place to be.one can sit for hours after walking around.well thought out. And the resteraunt is under a water fall.
Peaceful and Respectful. This is a lovely place in which to retreat from the bustle of the city. Although more of a museum than a monastery, it is still a place for contemplation.
Hidden treasure. Don't miss this if you visit Hong Kong. It is a lovely contrast to exploring the city. It is a hidden treasure.

Serene. Beautiful peaceful retreat from the busy city. Easy to get to on the mtr and so worth the trip. Beautiful bonsai and ponds. A place of worship so do remember to treat it with respect but the atmosphere is so lovely you won't want to disturb it anyway. The gardens next door are equally lovely

A place of calm. We visited here after visiting the gardens as many do, but it is worth a visit in its own right. We have visited vast numbers of religious sites across the world, this one is a bit special. The rocks and saying are worth a read and take a bit of time to appreciate the architecture. Recommended.

Impressive Complex. We had combined the visit to the Chi Lin Nunnery with a visit to the nearby Nan Lian Garden. It’s quite an impressive complex with several buildings. Although there weren’t obvious signs, photography is not permitted inside the buildings.This place exceeded my expectation and is definitely worth a visit. Buddhist chants can be heard amongst the buildings. It’s a very serene and peaceful place. Bonsai trees and a pond contribute to the calming atmosphere of the place.
A nice slice of Paradise in Kowloon. A short walk from the MTR Green Line Diamond Hill station, the Chi Lin Nunnery is a peaceful oasis in midst of the hustle and bustle of Kowloon.
Enchanting experience. Definitely worth a visit if you love Buddhist architecture and temples.The statues are masterpiece .

Serene and beautiful. Beautiful oasis in Hong Kong. Multiple temples in the nunnery. Many people come here to pray. Good signs of what you are seeing and their meaning in English. Courtyard has nice fountains. Take MTR to get here.
Lovely experience . Really worth going to see Chi Lin Nunnery and Nan Lian Gardens right next to it. Conveniently next to MTR and definitely worth going even when it's raining

A peaceful and tranquil place. Amazing bonsai.. The courtyard contains a most amazing collection of bonsai located in a beautiful and tranquil setting. There are several shrines which attract local worshippers and are both interesting and beautiful for visitors. The nunnery is located adjacent to Nan Lian gardens which are also worth a visit. Both nunnery and gardens have no entry charge and are located just a few minutes walk from Diamond Hill MTR

A place of sacred beauty. Right next to the equally stunning Nan Liang garden, the nunnery is part of a working temple. There is an exhibit with rare and unusual rocks, and locals pray and burn incense here. It is very serene and beautiful and the adjacent garden is very relaxing.

Calming experience. Walk among lush greenery and fine landscaping interspersed with pagodas and ponds full of Chinese Carp swimming in them. Nestled within a public housing estate and a stone's throw from the Diamond Hill MTR Station, a visit to Chi Lin Nunnery is guaranteed to refresh your mind.

A pleasant surprise!. We went here as I had read good reviews! Was certainly better than I expected. I was extremely impressed with the whole setting and landscaped gardens! It was an absolute pleasure to wander around the gardens exploring and appreciating all the hard work that goes into this! A very pleasant surprise in the middle of a big city! Just beautiful

Historic oasis. Beautiful complex a 5 to 10 minute walk from the Diamond Hill MTR. Very peaceful once inside, with traditional wooden roofs, decorative heads and statues, tranquil ponds, and several shrines and Buddhas. Some steps to get up to the level of the temple. Donation requested.We went over Chinese New Year and they were giving out red envelopes to all visitors, alongside a small market selling jade and other items to mark the animals for each birth year. The women in this area were very friendly and spoke good English. There was also a more typical tourist shop and toilet facilities, plus a cafe ( though we weren't sure if this was mainly for the other users of the centre which included a crèche, and didn't recognise the food so decided not to eat there).

Well Maintain Nunnery. Being a Buddhist temple within this nunnery, the whole complex gave an excellent serene atmosphere for worshipping. We went through the nunnery in half-an-hour however we could easily spend more than one hour enjoying the complex and the way of life of the nuns. The modern structures built few years back after the demolition of the previous slum has been well utilized for public usage. Great decision by the Hong Kong government.

Peaceful and serene . Very nice and well maintained gardens and temple with free entry. Some parts of the temple closed by 4.30 which we were not aware of (website was not functioning/not smart phone friendly) therefore it's probably best to arrive before 4pm.

Quiet, scenic and memorable. Along with Nan Lian Garden, this is perhaps one of the best places I visited in my recent trips. It's close to nature and entire scene is beautiful! One can get around the monastery in about half an hour and will still choose to stay because of the scene and its quietness. It's also a good experience to learn about Buddhism.The place is very accessible and is only a few minutes walk from Diamond Hill MTR station near Hollywood Plaza.

Brilliant free activity you can do. Very easy to find from the Diamond Hill MTR station. The Nunnery itself is beautiful. i visited on a weekday and it was empty. Very quiet and could walk around at my own pace. It was a shame there was no information guide as i would have liked to of known more about the site. The gardens directly outside the temple are also worth a visit.

serene and lovely place. Got the chance to explain to my youngest daughter about Buddhism..place was very serene and calm. No taking photos when inside the temple. reading the signs that were put up all around the area helped me explain to my daughter about their religion.
Visited on weekdays. This place is near Hollywood Plaza, Diamond Hill MTR, exit near Uniqlo. You may like to spend some time at Nan Lian Gardens nearby (opening hours 7am-9pm).

Hypnotising !. Wow. I have visited many religious sites across China and Hong Kong but the Chi Lin Nunnery really took my breath away. It had its own special feeling about it, well worth a visit to learn abit more about Buddhism. We went on a rainy day and still stayed for 1 hour plus outside in the rain walked in around!

Contemplation amidst Condos. To visit this nunnery is to experience a moment of calm and beauty amidst a world city teeming with tourism and human habitation. The architecture and the buddhist statuary also inspire reverence. A must-see for anyone who wants a non-commercial experience of Hong Kong.

Beautiful and peaceful. A quiet and peaceful place to wander around and then wander through the gardens. We went here with a guide on a private tour so they were able to explain the history of the nunnery and gardens.

Beautiful gardens, restaurant OK at best. We spent a morning walking around the stunning gardens and browsing around the gifts shop. I can highly recommend the garden and Nunnery but not the restaurant.
Next to NAn Ilan gardens. We were lucky to be able to go into this temple when we visited NAn Lian gardens this time, really worth a visit, lovely and calm, beautifully maintained
Surprising Oasis of Calm. The nunnery and surrounding gardens are an oasis of tranquility amidst the busy surroundings. Well worth a visit.
Must see. They keep the grounds so beautiful and the trees are amazing. The buildings are amazing, so close to the city but very serene.

Traditional Nunnery well worth the visit. We had a look through this nunnery while visiting the Nan Lien Gardens. Its beautiful and absolutely well kept inside and out. There are lots of interesting nunnery.
Beautiful Place. Definitely worth visiting, great tranquility and tradition in Hong Kong. Visit the gardens opposite and the vegetarian cafe whilst you are here as well. Easy to get to on the tube.

A nice break from the busy city. I got here in less than 20 minutes by train from the TST stop to Diamond Hill. I'm glad I had jotted down walking direction I got on line from the stop to the nunnery. It is close by ( less than a 5 minute walk) but there was no signage that I saw directing you to the nunnery. The buildings are quite spectacular and really has a nice tranquil atmosphere. The accompanying garden across the street is definitely worth a visit, as is the restaurant in the garden ( the Chi Lin restaurant ). A very pleasant day!

Peaceful. Chi lin nunnery is connected to Nan Lian Garden. If you'll visit the garden have some time to visit this place. Find peace as you walk to this solemn place. As we enter the nunnery, we were welcomed by the amazing view of the temple. It feels like being in the Chinese movies. Please be mindful while taking photos. There are part of the temple where you can't take photos.The people in the nunnery gave us candy, a small red enevelope with a coin inside and another bigger red envelope with candies and nuts. I'm not sure if its only for the Chinese New Year or they regularly gave thos gifts to visitors. I'm very grateful and will keep this gifts.

Interesting place to visit. Very pretty gardens and interesting nunnery. Nice place to spend a few hours with a great Chinese vegetarian restaurant - specializing in mushrooms. the buildings are beautiful and well maintained. Gardens nice to walk through. Enjoy taking foreign visitors to see this

Beautifully kept oasis amidst the high rise of HK. We were lucky that there were lots of festivities including lion/dragon dances during CNY. The Nunnery is a beautiful oasis to enjoy and wander around, it's also right opposite the Nan Lian Garden so makes it a worthwhile trip to escape the hussle and bustle of HK.

Amazing golden Buddhas... Next to Nan Lian gardens, this is part of the experience, beautiful teak architecture and peaceful retreat. Some absolutely amazing Buddha displays unfortunately you are not allowed to photograph them. Free entry and a lovely different experience in the busy city .

Amazing not to be missed. This temple is worth visiting. The atmosphere is incredible. It is quite extensive and offers also a beautiful Chinese style garden. In the first courtyard there are ancient and beautiful bonsai plants to admire. In my opinion absolutely a must see.

Beautiful Architecture, Peaceful Setting. The Chi Lin Nunnery is close enough to the city to get to easily, but far enough from the center to feel like another world. The buildings are beautifully constructed, and the grounds are peaceful. I even caught a glimpse of some of the nuns as they were attending to various duties around the temple. The nunnery (along with the Nan Lian Garden across the street) was an excellent way to spend a few hours.

So glad I went here. With a very limited time in HK I made sure to include this - it has so much to offer. Well signposted from the MRT; very peaceful inside and the contrast between it and the surrounding skyscrapers was marked. Just across the road are lovely gardens which are fastidiously tended; veggie restaurant is inside a waterfall and food very nice; model wooden Chinese buildings; Murano glass exhibition was stunning. An unexpected treat and cheap way to spend several hours
Compelling vibe. For those seeking inspiration, a delightful haven. Superb architecture and craftmanship. Even athiests and agnostics will find something to touch them.
Calm oasis in bustling Hong Kong. Worth finding this lovely place for a peaceful afternoon after the bustle of Hong Kong. Combine the visit with the gardens opposite
visit along with Nan Lian Garden. Connected to Nan Lian Garden by a bridge, both places are well worth a visit. A change from the city rush.

Beautiful secret place in the city centre. I love this place! It is easy to get there and often people don't believe that such a beautiful spot can be in the centre of HK! Amazing views and the garden are great to relax.
Tranquility in the city. This was a last minute decision but worthwhile. Only negative was we had only 30 minutes to have lunch.

Peace and tranqulility in the midst of chaos. We took the train to Diamond Hill from where this is a 5 minute stroll. Truly peaceful which is next to impossible to find in Hong Kong. Take your time and absorb the atmosphere of this magical place

A quiet place amid the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong . One of my favourite places in Hong Kong. A place I must visit every time I visit HK. Chi Lin Monastery and the garden next door the Nan Lian Garden. Most people think the architectures resemble Japan. In reality, it's Tang Dynasty style. The architect that built the monsters buildings visited the few temple structures left in China from around the Tang periods but visited Japan as well. This place is next to the Diamond Hill MTR station. A quiet place surrounded by high rises amid the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong.
An Oasis. Away from the hustling city, Chi Lin Nunnery provided a meditative environment to calm the mind. One has to be amazed that no nail was used to erect the buildings.

What a wonderful place. Once we explored the gardens, the natural thing to do was visit the nunnery. Beautiful buildings made of wood, with rock exhibits.Great to spend some quiet moments even if you are not a Budhist..

absolutely must do visit!. Unbelievably even friends we stayed with had not visited this stunning temple and gardens attached. Hidden away under motorway flyovers it is remarkable that this place inspires peace and harmony to such a degree. With beautiful gardens, restaurant, pagodas and loaded with atmosphere this is a great venue for all ages and is a great place to recharge your batteries. Hong Kong is exciting but can be exhausting so a place like this is a treasure especially as it too is surrounded by concrete building and busy roads, which remarkably do not impact on this special place. The train from Central takes you to Diamond Hill, with just one change, and the nunnery is a five minute walk from this station.My friends have now visited and were as enchanted as we were and will return with visitors in future so that is a good endorsement in itself. A tip is to allow yourselves a good amount of time as it just seems to melt away.
Relaxing place. It is very relaxing to wander around the yard of this Monastery but except for a few nice pictures, there isn't really much to see.

My favorite place in Hong Kong. Exquisitely reproduced Tang style nunnery with amazing architecture, stunning bonsai specimens everywhere, lily ponds, and an extraordinary collection of scholars' rocks on view when we visited. It is a wonderful haven of tranquility and beauty in this hectic city.
Beautiful. We enjoyed this very much, we got there in the evening but loved the serenity and architecture and it was easily connected to Nan Lian Gardens nearby.

Beautiful recreation of Tang architecture, a tranquil haven. This place is well worth a visit. A beautiful building you can't quite believe is modern, built in the style of the Tang dynasty. Very peaceful and tranquil place. Lovely gardens to stroll around next to the nunnery with decent shops and a cafe.
Fantastic Chi Lin Nunnery vegetarian restaurant also in the gardens, make sure you eat here!

Peaceful. Visited with guests not from HK, during the height of Summer. It gets very hot here! But that did not take away from the peace, calm and beauty of the nunnery. A welcome rest-bite from the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong city.
Absolutely worth a visit, would recommend the gardens also.

Tranquility . Combine a visit to the nunnery with the the Nan Lian Gardens which are nearby and close to Diamond Hill MTR station. Very striking architecture. Please note that photo taking is not allowed inside the temple
Loved the atmosphere. Definitely worth a visit, get off at MTR Diamond Hill. The nunnery is stunning and the main chambers with the Buddhas are great!

Great place to visit. The place is right in the middle of the city, the entrance is literally just under a busy flyover but inside the compound is very relaxing and peaceful you will forget you're in the city. Take time to explore the area and just immerse in the culture.Take note that tripods, monopods/selfie sticks are NOT allowed. Their security personnel are very quick to spot you. Almost all the places are "picture-worthy" but you cannot take pictures of the inside of the temples. Remember that it's a place of worship and not a photography studio (even if it's too tempting, please refrain).

Peaceful!!!. Beautiful place. Everything is expertly manicured. Great place to find a little inner peace in a bustling city!! Not a long visit but worth the MTR ride over. Station is only a block away. Lian Nan Garden is directly across the street and is worth the time to visit as well. Both places combine for an excellent journey.

Easy to walk through while at Big Buddha. You get a free snack with admission to the Big Buddha, worth walking through and was a nice break and place to sit down. The tea and noodles were quite good. Bathroom Tips: Bring toilet paper and the back of bathroom has the Western toilets.

Bonsai. Serenity oozes from this location... when you enter, you enter a hushed atmosphere rather like a library... except you are infinitely more aware of the respect being essential rather than mandated. There is a natural peace within the walls... as your eyes follow the Tang Dynasty's architectural lines over the landscape. You pause before the stunning bonsai after being given a new respect for them after watching Karate Kid in the 1980s. You can only imagine how many hours it has taken to create such impressive pieces. The amenities at the Nunnery were spotless ... the photo opportunities are abounding.... this is one of those tourist locations that you need to add to your list and spend some time losing yourself in the quietude.
A slice of serenity in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Kowloon.. Great afternoon walking through the nunnery - and a delicious vegetarian lunch too! What a treat to experience!
family trip. This is a great place to visit in the heart of the city. It is a quick MTR trip and the nunnery is really beautiful. Right next door is a beautiful garden area. I highly recommend this.

Beatific Gardens in the midst of the city. Was taken here by a local guide. What a contrast between the noise and bustle of the city and a beatiful peaceful place. The gardens are spectacular, with beautiful trees, plants, lakes and spectacular rocks. Well worth a visit!

Amazing garden, peaceful and quiet. We went to Chi Lin Nunnery after cancelling the trip to the Big Buddha due to the bad weather and we were not disappointed! It is a gem among the busy city. Big temple, amazing garden and architecture, great exhibitions and lovely vegetarian restaurant behind the waterfall. My parents (who live in HK and have never been to this place) were so surprised that such a nice and peaceful place exists in the middle of the city. It is a place where even locals will be amazed. A must to visit!
peaceful. Adjacent to the gardens and easily accessed by the MTR with station adjacent to the gardens. Allow at least 1 hour to view both.

A Must See Place when you visit Hong Kong. Chi Lin Nunnery is a must visit place in Hong Kong offering calm peaceful feeling as same as best beauty of the great garden surrounding the temple. Subway is the best way to travel to this temple and if possible come in the morning then there is less people and you will not believe that there is such a calm peaceful place in Hong Kong like this place!

Traditional Structures in HK. It was an amazing experience to see the old structures of traditional Chinese in the City. There is no entrance fee. You need to enter Nan Lian Garden then take the stairs to get to Chi Lin Nunnery. My Wife was very happy that we got to see this place. It is very accessible to get here too. It is right across the MTR station and plaza hollywood mall. It is a nice place to chill, to get out of the noise of the City.

Very,very,special....". Do not miss this very special Place. The physical plant is magnificent and the surrounding gardens are a tribute to beauty even on the the cold rainy day of our visit. No picture taking allowed inside - too bad- no picture taking.

Stunning in every way. Stunning building that has no nails used in its construction.Beautiful and peaceful place to visit. Very serene feeling even though it is surrounded by tall buildings.Close to the Nan Lian Garden which is also worth a look.Easy to get to by MRT followed by a very short walk (5 minutes max).2 good free attractions well worth visiting.
Peaceful!. Visited during the weekend, not very crowded, v calm serene and peaceful ambience. The place is very beautiful with lots of lotus and lily ponds around.

Peaceful and worth the MTR ride. Easy to get to via MTR, Diamond Hill. Beautiful prayer chanting, incredibly peaceful and tranquil. Lovely to be able to wander round. There was a nice security guard who clearly loved the place and gave us lots of additional info. Recommend you cross the road to also visit Nan Lian Gardens which are beautiful.
A must. The nunnery itself is great but you must look at it as a combination with the Nan Lian Gardens which are attached to each other one of our top 10 things to do in Hong Kong.

A simple quiet place to get away from the city. Tranquillity aside, you get to see a real Chinese Nunnery with actual nuns going about some of their daily routines (maintaining the temple halls) amidst the lotus ponds and quiet landscape
Very very beautiful place.. There was perfect place, it was very beautiful, nice architecture, quiet place, zen. There are the 1st plan to visit!!! Easy to go by mtr to Diamond Hill station.
Simple Gorgeous. Attached the the gardens and quite a convoluted way over the road and bridges, but a lovely buildiing filled with trees, pools and wooden architecture.
Nunnery. We had a delicious vegan lunch here. We were seat infront of the waterfall. The scenery is beautiful.

Surprisingly Tranquil. These gardens and monasteries make for a very relaxing visit for 1-2 hours. Very photogenic with small temples, gardens and ponds spread out throughout the complex. There is also a restaurant on site. Free to enter and easily accessible by the Diamond Hill MTR station.
Magnificent. Felt really big and small at the same time. Probably my favorite so far of the monestaries so far. It has a simplicity which makes it grand.
Unbelievable. Do not miss this. Amazing structure and beautiful gardens. Plan on some time to just sit and enjoy the serenity and beauty.
tranquil place. This place was very tranquil and offered respite against the hectic activity outside the gates. Spent about an hour enjoying the peace and quiet. Well worth a visit.

Oasis of greenery in a concrete jungle.. The Chi Lin Nunnery is located in a botanical garden that stands in stark contrast to the towering skyscrapers that ring this little oasis. The tradition architecture, the golden pavilion and immaculate gardens really make for some nice pictures. Plus it's a nice change from all of the in-your-face backlit signage and concrete if you want something a little more natural.

An Oasis of Calm. As wonderful and exciting as Hong Kong can be, it is not often described as tranquil and meditative. The charming, peaceful Chi Lin Nunnery is the perfect contrast to the urban energy of the rest of the city. Quite, reserved and meticulously maintained, this is the an oasis of prayer and peace in the dynamic city.

Great Day Out. I love coming here on a relaxing weekend- it's so easy to get to, beautiful, and surprisingly zen. Just take the MTR to diamond hill and it's a short walk from there. Just next door is a beautiful garden so you can wander around and make a whole day of it.
Peaceful and serenity. I would highly recommend Chi Lin nunnery. My highlight in Hong Kong, I would highly recommend going here and very close to the train station.

Good place to visit to appreciate Buddhism. It's an expansive courtyard and hall dedicated to prayer for Buddhists. It's a good place to visit given that it's just connected to Nan Lian Garden. Photos are prohibited inside the hall.
Best to visit in the colder months when flowers are in bloom as well.

Peace and quiet!. Do definitely go and visit this place and the garden next door.
Have a meal at the vegetarian Chinese restaurant there.
Its well connected by MTR and you need only a few hours, though can spend a day just relaxing and soaking in the quiet of the surroundings.

Small but beautiful temple in the very middle of the cityscape. The nunnery is a beautiful place in the very middle of a busy town. Together with the adjoining Nan Lian garden (look it up), it is one of the most unique places in HK. In the nunnery, you can see a collection of bonsai trees and lotus ponds, everything in a old, well maintained building.The visit will not take long time, but it is definitely worth it - both for those who want to see everything, and those that have the time only to quickly visit a few places in HK.

A break from the skyscrapers. If your bored of the malls and city-ness of HongKong head to Chi Lin Nunnery. Its in a much greener part of the city and there is a certain peace about this little place of worship admist all the tall buildings. I particularly liked the lotus ponds in the inner courtyards.
No people. I love this place. It's empty. You can walk around gardens in the middle of the city almost on your own. Everything is spotless. A nice way to spend a few hours.

Beautiful oasis in Hong Kong . A lovely piece of quiet calm in Hong Kong. The buildings are very well maintained and the environment is very serene. You can't take photos inside the nunnery walls. Admission is free.
Worth a look . An immaculately presented nunnery. Probably of more interest to mature people but it's free so I'd recommend to anyone. Great display if bonsais.
Enjoyed our visit. Lovely interesting visit to the nunnery today. Gardens within are immaculate and very peaceful. Free entry and nice to wander around for an hour or so.
serene and beautiful. It's a short MTR ride and a 2 minute walk from the station. It's worth an hour of your time. The Bonsai trees and gardens are amazing and beautiful. Very peaceful and lovely.

Oasis of calm in the middle of the city. We stumbled across the Nunnery by accident, but it ended up being a true highlight of our trip! Worth going out of your way to visit, the park is beautiful and the nunnery is even better!

Next to Nan Lian gardens. After visiting the lovely Nan Lain gardens (MTR green line, get off at Diamond Hill), a visit to the Chi Lin nunnery next door is a must. You are free to wander round the grounds and view the Buddha statues. Photographs can be taken outside, but not of the statues inside the buildings. A very tranquil setting and well worth a short visit in conjunction with the gardens

Traditional garden in between the Concrete Jungle. So this was my 4th week of Hong Kong and i had covered the usual -Victoria peak/Tian tan/ star ferry etc. and was ready for a different experience. The place is extremely easy to get to , its situated just next to the MTR station and a Mall so you are covered even if a walk in the park isn't your kind of thing. However i do recommend a visit here once you are done with all the superficial things in HK.The place itself is very calm and beautiful, you get a glimpse of HK high rise along with the traditional temple and that makes a pretty picture. Most importantly there is a vegetarian restaurant right inside the premise that made my day :).To all those who have been to Japan its similar to the Japanese garden that you will find in Himeji Castle ...

Divine. It is a tranquil peaceful oasis. I wish I had come here earlier in my month visit I would have returned. We would echo all the positive comments of TAs. I know it's new but it is clearly a sacred place already because of the Mission of the whole complex. The nunnery and the Garden are in the middle of a very busy dual carriageway but you really would not know. (92 from Diamond Hill interchange). We got a taxi from the Kowloon City Pier 35HKD having got the Tube to North Point. It's a great way to get here the views of the old airport etc are interesting.
worth the effort. Took a longer MRT ride to get to, but well worth it. Gorgeous grounds. Very quiet and peaceful in the midst of the city.

A must see. This is a beautiful complex worthy of a visit. Combine it with a visit to the neighboring gardens and you will have a great day out and it costs you nothing. I have been several times and always love the peaceful atmosphere. Great for photos.
A must do. What a wonderful oasis in the middle of HK. The gardens, bonsai, nunnery and whole area is stunning. Put this high on your to do list whilst visiting HK.

A little out of the way. This is a little out of the way but combine the visit with the Gardens next door and it is well worth taking the effort to visit both for a few hours. Easy access from the MTR.
Hidden Gem. definitely a hidden gem in the city. Feel completely submerged in this very serene landscape of the Nan Lian Gardens. Really delicious vegetarian meal too!
Serene. Relaxing and peaceful to the eyes. A courtyard filled with perfectly trimmed bonsai trees and four lotus ponds. Overall relaxed feeling
Lovely spot!. This was a really lovely spot yo visit. We spent a couple of hours at the nunnery and in the gardens. Worth a trip out to see.
A nice surprise . Well worth the MTR ride to get there. Fantastic architecture set in beautiful gardens. The best thing we have seen in Hong Kong.
Absolutely stunning. What a place?!?!? So beautiful and serene. The gardens in the Nunnery and across the road are amazing. Really lovely place to visit.

Right next to Nan Lian garden. It is located on Kowloon side of Hong Kong. There's temple halls, nunnery & Chinese gardens. It is said to be built according to style of Tang Dynasty traditional Chinese architecture. The buildings are built without a single iron nails.

Delightful. What a lovely place...serene and peaceful.lovely manicured gardens and a couple of bridges to cross...we were there when the chanting was going so this was a highlight..if you have a couple of spare hours this place is easy to get to,costs nothing and is very inspiring

Gorgeous. Beautiful, a really nice place to spend time. Gardens are well kept and relatively peaceful, although quite busy with tourists. The gardens have a few interesting exhibits too, but we really enjoyed the nunnery's main hall and learning about the deities pictured.

In the top 10 of HK. This is a very beautiful and quiet place
This nunnery has been build recently but in an old style without any nail
There are nice bonsai and lotus

Beautifull and Peaceful. This is just a beautifully maintained place and a peaceful one. Make sure you drop by before 16:30 in order to be able to go inside. It is well worth it for the gardens nonetheless. I should point out the amazing replicated ancient architechture of "no screws allowed". It´s just wonderful how everything fits like a puzzle. Keep your eye out for the corner foundations to get a good glimpse at the inticracy.Other than that, the gardens are just wonderful.

Hidden Gem worth a visit. I had some spare time to kill today and decided to take the MTR to Diamond Hill. I knew there was some kind of temple there, but I was pleasantly surprised by what I found. Not only is there the amazing Chi Lin Nunnery, but just below is the Nan Lian Garden. Well worth a visit.

Beautiful and serene. This wonderful space is right next to the most ornate gardens they are linked by a bridge and both are completely free to visitors. There are plenty of signs in English that help direct and inform you. The nuns and monks are around and you will see, hear and smell the charms of this beautiful space. Well worth the visit and take some time to simply absorb the peacefulness especially in such a busy and crazy city. Take green MTR line to diamond hill and follow the signs it's a 2 minute walk. Enjoy.

Beautiful Structures and Gardens. Everything here is built without any nails! Fascinating. This place is really beautiful, I suggest going here early before all the tour busses arrive and swarm the place. Beter pictures and a more peaceful atmosphere that way!

A new experience for all of us.. A family of 5 with 2 teenage sons and a 21year old who is living in Hong Kong. On her suggestion we visited the Nunnery and it is a place my daughter will definitely be revisiting. Calming, serene and intriguing place to visit.

My favorite place in Hong Kong. During our 5 day stay in HK, this was my favorite activity. My daughter recommended it. She said that it was stunning and she was correct. We were brave and we took public transportation to get there and we did not have much trouble. Transportation in HK in organized. We saw the gardens next door first and it was so worth it. I liked the contrast between the serene garden and skyscrapers in the distance. The gardens were an oasis. We skipped the High Tea at the Peninsula Hotel. We ended up eating at the vegetarian restaurant on the nunnery grounds instead. WE were not sorry that we made that choice. Then, we went across the street to view the nunnery. We went back to the gardens to sit and enjoy the serenity before leaving. It was free to view the grounds of the garden and the nunnery!!

A special treat. Our private guide (Jacky Wong) took us here and it was a special treat to see the surrounding gardens and the temple.We were lucky to see a service, so no pictures inside the temple. It was awe-inspiring !
Hidden Treasure. Unexpected spot of serenity in the middle of a very busy city.Worth an hour to explore the gardens and slow down to experience the Nunnery. Definitely a must see!

Three attractions in One. The nunnery is an architectural gem easily acccible by MTR worth a visit on its own right, but you can get three birds with one stone when you combine the nunnery with the adjacent gardens and a lunch at the excellent vegetarian restaurant on-site. Ideally, you should time your visit so that you can be at the park's vegetarian restaurant just before it opens at noon. The day I went, the noon-1:30 settings filled up by 12:10. Both the gardens and nunnery are free, and the restaurant is a bargain offering 4-8 course meals for $120-$200 HKD (15 to 25 USD) per person.

Tang style architecture. This was the first building where we could actually see how the buildings during the Tang dynasty were constructed because the pieces were not covered in painted decorations. The nunnery is lovely and peaceful. I found the niche devoted to Kwan Yin the most moving. The niche with the tablets for former head nuns had an explanatory text that finally explained why ancestral halls were established and maintained. In the basement, there is a lovely gift shop. The women shop assistants could not have been more helpful or pleasant. We left feeling revived.I would recommend a visit to this nunner for anyone interested in Chinese architecture, Buddhism, or in need of a place in which to gather one's thoughts.
Small but lush. Loved the waterlilies watered by dragons, the architecture is typical but well done and the idols are quite stunning. Its basically a very nice courtyard.
Beautiful. Beautiful gardens with koi ponds, lotus ponds and beautiful bonsai trees. The scene is perfect with the skyscrapers in the background of the gardens.
A beautiful place. Super amazing place, the deities look amazing, and the lotus flower around give a sense of serenity that you won't believe this place is in the middle of the city

Beautiful. Definitely, one of the best attractions in Hong Kong we visited. The nunnery was quiet and peaceful, delicate and detailed architecture and an amazing garden.
Great way to head away from the crowds. Conveniently located close to the MTR.
Silence in hk. Relax atmosphere , next to nan lian Gardens . Easy to reach by Mtr . Surprisingly less people visit this spot .

Harmony in the urban jungle and a veggie delight. Wonderful and ran quilt in the middle of Hong Kong. Arrive here my underground and you are in another world of religious harmony and meditation. The stone sculptures are wonderful. If you are a veggie this restaurant is a must, lovingly crafted meals with organic ingredients cooked on site by the religious community there wonderful a pilgrimage in itself.
Lunch at the Veggie Restauant. There is a stillness and a feeling of zen at the Nunnery. An oasis of calm. You must eat at veggie restaurant - tasty. Offers a lovely retreat from the busy Hong Kong.
Tranquil and beautiful. Definitely, one of the best attractions in Hong Kong. Great way to head away from the crowds. Conveniently located close to the MTR.

A beautiful example of traditional architecture. The buildings are stunning and the gardens surrounding equally so but unfortunately the nunnery was closed when we arrived so we were unable to go inside. We still got to enjoy them from the outside and the gardens around though and from that alone I would suggest it for a visit during your holiday.

Breathtaking beauty. Not to be missed. Serene and tranquil. We reached during the prayer times so it was filled with the soft sound of hymns. A perfect finish to a walk in the Nan Lian garden.
A mere 5 mins walk from the Diamond Hill MTR station.

Nice architecture. Traditional architecture. Nice inner sanctum. Take the sub to diamond hill. Exit at the streetside and just follow the signs. Don't forget to visit the garden at the other side of the road.

Tranquility amongst the Choas of HK. Beautiful Temple and a must visit if in Hong Kong. Walk in and around the buildings soaking up the peaceful atmosphere then explore the inner temple and see the large statues of Buddha. Afterwards walk to the Nan Lian Garden which is very beautiful and perfect for picture taking. A great way to spend an hour or 2.

Tranquillity and serenity. Enter by going through Nan Lian Garden and up the stairs near the Yellow Pagoda to cross the walkway directly to the temples.The many small and one large temple offer moments of meditation. The ponds with their water lilies and small fountains are mesmerizing.It is a very large space, so even with many tourists or locals strolling it does not feel crowded. Watch for the Pyrocantha encased in wire mesh - a beautiful example of bonzai.

Handsome, peaceful, and informative. There are many grand temples in Hong Kong -- Po Lin, Yuan Yuan, Man Mo, etc. They're all colorfully painted and full of impressive statuary. Then there is Chi Lin, serene and contemplative in beautifully maintained, unadorned natural wood. There is a wonderful hush at the Nunnery that everyone respects. In each hall of the nunnery, there are plaques explaining the statuary, something that is completely missing in the other temples. On top of this, the Nunnery is a short 5-minute walk from the Diamond Hill MTR station and right across the street is the Ming-style Nan Lian Gardens with an exhibit on the architecture and joinery of the temples, as well as a very good vegetarian restaurant.

Tranquil Spot in a busy City. Chi Lin Nunnery has lots of history and is located easy from the MTR in Diamond Hill. The surrounding park is very Zhen and peaceful and the nunnery gives beautiful views of the surrounds. There is a nice restaurant but booking is essential for lunch.

Wonderful to see such beautiful garden !. The Chi Lin Nunnery was built with enormous effort from a lot of people. Most of the trees were transported with utmost care from China. The buildings were so beautifully built in old traditional way. The pond was in the middle of the park - full of color. One must try the Vegetarian Restaurant, set beside a big water fall with glass windows overlooking the garden. Excellent cuisine and service, book ahead in order not to miss the food.

Beautiful and peaceful. Don't miss the chance to visit Chi Lin Nunnery. It is one of the most fascinating places to visit. It is so peaceful and the gardens and buildings are truly outstanding. I have been here several times and never cease to be amazed by its complex building process.Don't forget to cross over to Nan Lian Gardens when you manage to drag yourself away from this place

Goto place if you are looking for a quiet place. If you want to avoid the incense smell and the bustling tourist in Wong Tai Sin , this is just the place to go . You can slowly take in the beauty of the architecture , looking at the plants and enjoy the cool weather in Dec . Do remember to spend some time walking around the Nan Lian Garden which is just opposite the Nunnery.
Wow !!!! . Really a serene place to visit. We can experience Tang Dynasty architecture. I highly reccommend any visitor to find out more infor regarding this Nunnery before visiting.

Good to visit with Nan lian garden. A peaceful place with beautiful deities of Buddha and others. Nice description given about each deity. A large compound with beautiful architecture and connection to Nan Lian Garden. It also has a shop for souvenirs and a place for eating. There are well maintained buildings in back. Easy to reach and one can cover it in 30 – 45 minutes along with Nan Lian garden.

Awe-inspiring even if you are not a Buddhist. We visited here in Feb 2015 and found it to be a fantastic experience. Enter through the Nan-Lian Gardens and then journey on through to the Nunnery. I found it amazing to see the juxta-positioning of old-school Chinese buildings set against the backdrop of modern HK. This is a Must-Do for anyone spiritual or interested in culture.

Tranquil. If you are visiting the gardens might as well keep the peaceful afternoon alive and visit this very interesting nunnery just across the street. Never visited one before and not only learned a lot but enjoyed taking it all in.

Hidden Gem. Visit the tourist information office by the pier and they will offer good suggestions. They advised that we visited the Chi Lin Nunnery which was about 20 minutes away on the subway train, it was a Buddhist nunnery with beautiful gardens and opposite it was a Japanese botanical garden spread over several acres; a tranquil oasis in a very busy city

A Hong Kong Gem!. You must visit the Nan Liam Garden and attached Chi Lin Nunnery for the serenity and drop-dead gorgeous gardens as well as for the majesty of the Nunnery complex. You can get there by subway, one change if from Central or try the 671 bus from Causeway near the fire station for a fascinating top-deck view of the Hong Kong and Kowloon areas where people live. Diamond Hill MTR station at Hollywood Plaza is adjacent to the gardens. The complex is free, the gardens and the buildings are amazingly beautiful, the peace and serenity just wash away all the noise and bustle of Hong Kong, and you can rest with a tea or coffee and a snack or even have a meal. The bonsai trees are a marvel in the Nunnery grounds. Even the public toilets are a marvel of cleanliness! It's a bit of a journey to get out there (expensive by taxi so use public transport) but you will not regret your visit to this site. I visit HK annually so I am hoping to have a pure sunny day so I can zip out here for perfect photos.
Peaceful & tranquil. A peaceful oasis from the city, architecture itself is amazing - palace was built without a single nail. A great place to walk around and take in the serenity of the park.

Beautiful & peaceful break from the city lights. If you plan to visit Nan Lian Gardens then you cannot miss a wander up to the Chi Lin Nunnery. Just take the MTR up to Diamond Hill and enjoy the tranquility this place will offer. It's fairly small so it won't take long to visit if you're short on time.

A peaceful place to retreat. After running around in busy and noise HK, the best place to get away from it all is to visit Chi Lin Nunnery and Nan Lian Garden. You may not be able to visit the nunnery but the temple complex is very well built and maintained. It is very clean and tranquil and you can be at peace in no time. There is no burning of incense so it is very different from the usual Chinese temple. There is very little praying going on as most of the visitors are respectful tourists, so it is pretty solemn.
Interesting nunnery. One of those holy places with amazing structures that puts you in awe, free for the public, not very crowded though its across the road from Nan Lian Garden

Walk through the Beautiful Nan Lian Garden to the Nunnery for Lunch. Make reservations! The restaurant looks out to the Garden through a waterfall which is very soothing. The food was very good. No alcohol served but the smoothies were fantastic! I recommend.
Peaceful. Elegant, formal and peaceful site. Free admission, just a short walk from Diamnond Hill MTR station.
Small yet peaceful place . The place is smaller than I expected. However, the building is beautiful and just across from Nan Lian Garden. So, it is ok to be able to visit 2 places at a time.

Built to last a thousand years - just 17 years ago. There you are on Diamond Hill in Kowloon, huge skyscrapers all around. How can a gentle breeze be caressing your cheek, birds nattering quietly from the sculpted trees, and a young woman standing at the edge of a large pond tossing fish food to more than 50 very, very large carp frothing hungrily before her? it's the Chi Lin Nunnery garden, a truly astonishing place to visit in the midst of Hong Kong's 7.2 million residents. Leave the garden and stroll over the long road-crossing pedestrian bridge to the equally astonishing monastery complex, built entirely of wood with no metal whatsoever except for some decorative touches. Walk through gates and a courtyard and another gate and another courtyard and end up in the Main Hall with its five large golden statues portraying the Buddha, two Bodhisattva, and two disciples. No photography in the Main Hall, but allowed elsewhere. It must have cost hundreds of millions to build the complex and the garden, and the result showcases the Chinese aesthetic sensibility and building and gardening skills. There is a hall which includes detailed models of earlier monasteries and other buildings which inspired this one. It is almost easier to understand how the Chi Lin buildings were designed and created than how the very large garden came into being since gardens take a good deal of time to come into their own. This one, while there are a few places in it that seem not yet fully evolved, on the whole is quite like a garden that has been around for a very long time. The rocks, perhaps a bit excessive in a couple of places, are world class. The trees are bonsaied and pruned magnificently, and all the elements have been placed according to an exquisite sensibility. If you like beauty and nature and peace, this is the place to go.

This nunnery is beautiful and a family gem. I have been going to Chi Lin Nunnery ever since I was a kid when my father was building this place. After many years of not visiting HK I was finally able to show my wife the intricate designs of the wooden buildings and Lotus Flowers
Chi lin november 2015. This is such a beautiful place. It's so serene and calm and this right in the middle of the city of Hongkong. It's a must do!

Tranquil Beauty. We visited to fill in an afternoon and are very thankful we did. A most extraordinary place surrounded by high rise buildings. The tranquility of the beautiful chinese gardens with their manicured giant topiary plants was incredible. The temple has many Buddha's and reading up on these is fascinating. A must visit!

Do Go. Well worth the visit, very tranquil and peaceful and good to get away from the fast city life. A little different and a nice change from the temples. Don't miss the gardens which are just across the footbridge, very pretty, lots of photo opportunities. Easy access from the MTR.

Chi Lin nunnery . This is really worth seeing. Such a peaceful and relaxing place. The nunnery is beautiful and the Statues within are amazing. The Nan Lian Gardens are right next door and are really fantastic. I recommend going earlier in the day as the afternoon was pretty hot.

Beautiful restaurant with great vegetarian food in a gorgeous setting. The restaurant has a waterfall outside the window, and terrific vegetarian food. After dinner, we walked the grounds, with beautiful rocks, trees, and temples.
Spectacular!. Spectacular nunnery, very easy to access by MTR and peaceful to explore. The adjacent gardens are beautiful!

Stunning!. By far the best tourist attraction I have seen in Hong Kong. I visited on a week day, which was ideal as I was one of the only tourists there. It's barely been commercialised, and the gardens next door are absolutely breath taking. One of the best photo spots in Hong Kong!
Loved our visit. Wonderful work made by the nuns for sale. Interesting visit. Very friendly. Would like to go back again.

Quite relaxing and nice views . I had a very good time visit the Nan Lian Garden and seeing the Nonne Cluster. It's a must see and experience the silence an all the details into gardening. There is an amazing change to see an Exhibition for enamel work.

Beautiful oasis of calm. An amazing place surrounded by the modern skyscrapers of Hong Kong. Right next door to the Chin Lin gardens - so you can easily combine the two and once again its a free attraction.

Peace and Quiet. Chi Lin Nunnery is a next door neighbor to Nan Lian Garden. You can just walk over. It was literally going from one paradise to the next. The grounds were well kept and every one was respectful of the tranquil place. You can hear the monks chanting in the background that really relaxed and soothed my weary self.
Peaceful. Wander around this setting. So peaceful & the golden Buddha etc are beautiful. Then go to the Nan Lian Garden after.

Relaxing and peaceful. This place is not at all crowded as other more popular temples in Hong Kong. Chi Lin is peaceful to walk around in either by yourself, with friends or your beloved one. There are ponds and some short walking trails in the area

Beautiful.. Catch the MTR to Diamond Hill and follow the signs, its very close. We entered through the Nan Lian Gardens which we explored first. Both the nunnery and the gardens are beautifully maintained and set out. There are some wonderful potted bonsai in the nunnery courtyard and every tree in the gardens is manicured and shaped like a bonsai. The central lake has a colourful temple on the island in the middle and there is also a very large waterwheel in the corner of the garden. The whole place is a photographer's dream.

Interesting and quiet. A nice respite from the bustle of the City. A fair number of tourists but still quiet. Fairly hilly walk to get there but the path is paved and you feel really accomplished when you reach the top!

A wonderful visit. I would highly recommend this nunnery to tourists and locals alike. It is very peaceful and prettily laid out. I spent a long time looking at the carp and dragonflies in the various ponds. The Nan Lian Gardens are connected, and also worth a visit. There's a very pleasant restaurant under the waterfall in the gardens, which serves vegetarian food.
Beautiful. The Nunnery is exquisite in the gardens and the upkeep of the buildings and statuary. Photos are permitted in some areas, but not others. Selfie Sticks are banned.

Visit along with Nan Lian Garden. We visited the nunnery along with the wonderful Nan Lian Garden near the Diamond Hill MTR station. Also, a shopping mall nearby. Had been to Hong Kong before and this was a nice site to visit in Kowloon.

Quiet place in Hong Kong. Went there with family and really enjoyed the peaceful atmosphere in the temple above the garden. Visitors can see all the Buddha statues and also enjoy the quiet that is sometimes hard to find in HK. Is a short ten minute walk from the Diamond Hill MTR station.

Somewhere to visit in Hong Kong. This is physically connected to the Nan Lian Garden, so you'd visit both in the same trip. It's a pleasant break for 30mins to an hour from the noise and bustle of Kowloon. The complex is relatively small (at least the are open to the public), but interesting for a quick look, particular if (like me) you are unfamiliar with Buddhist temples...and its very easy to reach, being just a few minutes from the Diamond Hill MTR.
well kept and nice. visited with my mother. very well kept. a bit sparse. very nice bonsai trees. lots of beautiful Buddhas for those to want to pray and bow. very serene

Beatiful Temple. Chi Lin Nunnery is a beautiful Buddhist monastery along with a garden. Reaching here is not difficult either in case you follow signs from the Metro Station. You can also see the Nan Lian Garden which is next to it. Spend few time in peace and tranquility.A must visit.

Breath taking experience. I thoroughly enjoyed visiting the nunnery - easy to get to, just follow the signs from diamond hill MTR. Peaceful, beautiful and gorgeous experience. Lovely gift shop too (though quite pricey!)
Recommended. Glad to visit this place. A beautiful nunnery and quite calm and serene place couple of hours would be more than enough in this place...

What a find!. Japanese-style gardens attached to Buddhist nunnery in the middle of the harsh built-up landscape that is Hong Kong. Here you will find serenity, peace, tranquility. Those who love gardens will love the variations and juxtaposition of hard and soft landscaping, of water and earth. Here you can refresh your mind with a chinese tea infusion; here you will forget the hustle and bustle just a stone throw away. Fabulous in every way.

Picked Out From Our Lonely Planet Guide. This wasnt on our original to do list but spotted it in Lonely Planet and so glad we visited. It was absolutely exquisite, beautiful surroundings immaculately kept and possibly some of the nicest treasures and objects that we saw on our trip. We will certainly be recommending that our friends and family visit.

Serene. It'll only take you about 15-20 minutes to see, but Chi Lin Nunnery is worth the trip, especially if you're already going up to see Nan Lian. Serene and peaceful, this is the closest to an out-of-body experience I had during my trip to Hong Kong.

Serene. A visit to this nunnery was unplanned, however due to extra time we could manage! The place is serene, offers peaceful getaway in the heart of the city. The cafeteria is vegetarian(no eggs, no meat) which was plus for a person like me. the gardens are well maintained, lotus pond is good. The temple is peaceful.
peace oasis in the city. ery cool place combined between quite & spiritual feelings make u feel peaceful & comfort all the way long with it .
beautiful place. I like this place so much. Very beautiful place. And i think this place is looks like palace in forbidden city. Hehehehe... anyway, i love it

Tranquil and an oasis in Hong Kong. Easy to get there via the MTR and along withe gardens on the opposite side of the road this is a great place to chill out and forget you're in a vast city.
Lots of Bonsai trees and greenery set the atomospher in what is a very holy place.
No charge a a real treat.

Oasis in the city. Along with the Nan Lian Garden, this is an easy to get to must-see for Hong Kong. Pristine setting and an oasis in the city. Monks chanting, birds signing, and locals praying to Buddha were a welcome respite. Highly recommend.

Peace and tranquility. Visit this place along with the Nan Liam gardens and you will get a wonderful education in spiritual peace and tranquility. This and the gardens are clean and quiet, they exude calm and content, and they are beautiful places just to walk and admire. After the thunderous city, this is good for the soul!

Nice place. Second time here but with 10 years different. IT still looks the same and the trees is still under good maintain. Quiet and peacefull place, and now it is also possible to viset
the beautiful Garden near by

Beautiful place, this is the closest place to feel in Japan. A must visit! Inside the urban busy city you have this quite place with this beautiful garden that is well maintained, I really recommend you to go there for some pictures and zen feeling :)
Worth the visit
Acually spotted 2 nuns.. Some of the cleanest Buddha's in Hong Kong. Beautiful artwork throughout the Nunnery. We were lucky enough to see 2 nuns while there (they are somewhat reclusive).
An oasis. Short walk from tube, tranquil and beautiful in the middle of a very busy city. We got a taxi from star ferry as running late cost - £5.

Definitely worth the visit . This is a must stop on anyone's visit.. as are the Gardens just over the road from it.. The nunnery has been rebuilt in Tang dynasty design. Most of it is easily accessible for wheelchair users.. Then grab the MTR for another top attraction.

Oasis . A little oasis in Hong Kong! It is a gorgeous garden with beautifully manicured flora and many quiet retreats. The coffee shop was just what was needed on a hot summers day the frozen ice refresher was just what was needed. A must do for a traditional Chinese experience in Hong Kong

Buy the book. Photos are not allowed to be taken in the Great Hall, which has the most magnificent golden Buddha and his helpers. I bought the book about the nunnery it only cost 20hk dollar (£2), not only does it describe everything in detail but it helps towards the upkeep of the nunnery.

Beautiful . Such a beautiful and tranquil place surrounded by the city and high rises but you feel a million miles away from that.
Gardens are spectacular and very relaxing to walk around
Well worth a visit

Awesome!. I loved this. It is relatively new (rebuilt in the 1990's), so don't bother if only old temples are your thing. However, if you like temples and like beautiful architecture you should stop by if you have time. Seeing this in addition to Nan Lian Garden is a great way to spend an afternoon. Both places are so peaceful, which is surprising considering where they are located.

A well renovated nunnery in a modern city. It is very classically built and well renovated, although you may find it is too new with no smell of heritage. it has two parts of buildings. On one side, you ca find classically built corridor and doors. On the other side, there is a nice pond and golden statue.If you go there, do not forget to try the tea and nice vegetarian dim sum behind the waterfall.Enjoy a peaceful moment in a modern city.
a gem at Diamond hill. the Chi Lin Nunnery was a wonderfully peaceful and serene visit, the architecture was breathtaking and in amongst the high rise density of Diamond Hill.
chilling in Chi lin. it's always a good idea to visit this tranquil place in the middle of busy bustling Hong Kong. Spend quiet time exploring the temple.

Tranquility. What a wonderful place. When you are over the hustle and bustle of HK this place is beautiful and peaceful. The temple itself is very impressive with many Buddhas and the gardens are a nice place to sit and relax. Don't miss the adjoining Nan Lian Gardens which are beautifully kept.

Wonderful Buddhist Temple with beautiful gradens. Chi Lin Nunnery is a wonderful Buddhist complex situated at the Diamon Hills. It boasts a beautiful and large garden. Across the road lies another garden consisting of a vegetarian cafe and restaurant. Good for pure vegetarian people who otherwise find it difficult to get vegetarian food in Hong Kong. But, beware! The restaurant is on an expensive side.
Nunnery with theme park. Connects with theme park. Welcome to take a look from the park. Silence & peace. Have special purpose in there.

Quiet hours between the HK excitement. Spent an afternoon here having heard about this from a tour guide friend in the UK. Calm place, pleasant gardens. (Do not' miss these - you have to cross the bridge and walk down the steps into the gardens. Some visitors thought the nunnery was just the large wooden structure and courtyards). Inside the garden you can eat in a restaurant behind a waterfall. Simple food, brisk service, but very good value and pleasant way to have a meal.
Beautiful Temple!. If you are the Nan Lian Garden, might as well visit this gorgeous temple! It is serene and a rarity in HK. If you are in the area, it is definitely a must see!
A pleasant place to visit. A nice and well kept place. Worth to spend one to two hours there. Free entrance, quiet and nice scenery.
Nice place to visit. Went after visiting Nian Lin Garden, beautiful nunnery, well kept, went on a Monday so not busy at all.
Beautiful. A stunning place. Lovely peaceful area. Easy to get to. Worth visiting. Remember not to take photos of shrines
Don't miss. Amazing architecture, definitely worth the visit. We even managed to see the monks praying. It is a very relaxing place in the middle of this busy city.

Wonderful insight into the ancient architecture and Buddishm. The nunnery and gardens outside provide a fantastic look into the ancient architecture style of the buildings (no screws or nails - all pieces interlock with one another) and the Buddhist way of life. You'll commonly see Buddhist nuns doing their daily prayers and meditation, and the effigies are exquisite.
Peaceful and informative . The nunnery and adjacent gardens were great. A little bit out of the way, but worth it. Can be reached by bus very easily.

Don't miss Chi Lin Nunnery. This is a location that no one should miss when in Hong Kong. It is easy to get to and has amazing grounds and displays. It is not crowded and you can take some beautiful pictures.

Great surprise. We loved it!!! What a pleasant surprise - authentic and real - both the gardens and the nunnery exceeded our expectation (had no preconceived ideas or knowledge and just stumbled on it). Free to visit and a super way to spend an hour or two.
Stunning!. I came here for the vegetarian banquet under the waterfall and ended up spending half a day here. The gardens were stunning! Such a lovely oasis hidden in such a buzzing city.
Inspiring . If you're heading to the Nan Lian Gardens make sure you take the time to stop and see the Chi Lin Nunnery. We were lucky enough to be there while the nun's were praying

Serenity. Very easy to find along with the Nan Lian Garden and exceptionally easy to get to on the MTR. Its a lovely area to spend some time wandering and enjoying the extremely peaceful space. They request no photos to be taken inside which is understandable but also a shame as its brilliant and contains some amazing statues. Well worth the visit, especially as its connected to the Garden.

Lovely. What a delight the Chi Lin Nunnery is, the sense of peace when you first walk in continues the entire visit.The architecture is wonderful, the lotus water ponds are very pretty. Loved it & would go back again if had the chance.It's easy to get to on the green line to Diamond Hill and see the gardens across the road while your there.

Do not miss!!. I was very surprised by the beauty of the gardens here. It really is a must see! Can be a quick stop on the way somewhere else too. The gardens were immaculately kept and absolutely stunning. Very peaceful!!

Peaceful and pleasant.. Easy to find from Diamond Hill MTR. Free entry to Nunnery and adjoining Nan Lian gardens - quiet, peaceful and what I was expecting from a Chinese garden - much better than Yuyuan Garden in Shanghai.Look out for the restaurant behind the waterfall. Also note you cannot sit down or consume food or drink, except in designated areas - the wardens will tell you off if you do!
It would be more beautiful when aged. The architecture is beautiful but it looks brand new, there is something missing, perhaps if it 'ages', it looks more beautiful.
Good little detour. A little bit of calm in a busy city. What a beautiful place and so easy to get to. Thoroughly recommend.

A moment to reflect. This a a quiet place just out of the madness of Hong Kong. It is really interesting to see the contrast of Hong Kong high rise against the traditional quiet stillness of a religious retreat

Beautiful and historical.. We enjoyed our trip to Chi Lin Nunnery.It was east to get to from where we stayed at Mongkok. We took the MTR to Diamond Hill, and then walked about 10 mins.There was clearly marked signs for which way to go.Once there, we felt very peaceful and calm. There were some locals there offering fruit, and praying. It was not very busy or crowded though. Almost a little escape from the city surrounding the gardens. The architecture was perfect example from many years ago.

Amazing culture in the middle of the city. We visited the Nunnery on a very wet day in January. Our last stop on a whirlwind trip of HK. We almost let the rain stop us from going plus our kids wanted to stay at the hotel. The gardens were absolutely gorgeous, the building awe inspiring. We were pretty much the only people there, which made it all the more special. Both my husband and myself agree it was definitely the high light of our trip. Don't visit at your peril...

Great place. What a fantastic building. Very peaceful and nice bonzai gardens. Well worth a look to absorb the meditational atmosphere and it's attached to the nian lin gardens so two free sights in one.

Relaxing, peaceful. Leave technology behind. Incredibly peaceful, calm right in the middle of the city. Highly recommended. It is next to the Nan Lian Garden which is also very nice to walk and leave technology behind

Peaceful. The nunnery grounds are picturesque with all the waterlily ponds surrounded by walls. The temple is quiet with some faint chanting from the monks. Visit the Souvenir shop as they have some lovely gifts to take home. Don’t forget to visit the Nan Liang Gardens next door as they are spectacular.

Lovely...Serene...beautiful !. M friend recommended me this place ;-) And I am truly thankful that he did !I am a spiritual solo traveller ! And exploring the spiritual side of Hong Kong was my key goal in this trip ! I went on a nice cloudy breezy morning to visit this place...its well accessible from Diamond Hill MTR. The walk to the plac itself was pleasant as the weather was lovely. As soon as I entered , it started drizzling ! The beauty of this place just glorified in the rains! There were very few people inside and the peace was just sinking in...The garden is maintained perfectly and is of significance. They have a souvenier shop as well. The feel that you get in the main Altar is ineffable and one should experience that to understand this place ;-) The architecture is lovely and flawless !My friend had recommended Nan Li garden (just in front of the Nunnery across the road), however I could just barely spend five minutes due to time constraint !In short, its worth a visit !
An oasis of calm in the city.. Wonderfully cared for. So relaxing. Make sure you cross the over pass into the gardens next door. Loved it.

Serene location to get away from the hustle and bustle. Nice place to visit if you have some time to kill. MTR and bus stops nearby so fairly convenient to get to. But there is not much to do or see so it is only suitable for a short visit
Nice place. I went there with my family and I found the place was interesting with well-maintained garden with temple. However there lack information for tourist for what we shouldn't do there.
Peaceful . What a truly amazing place. Absolutely stunning and there is a sense of peace that is just delightful! The bonsai gardens are beautiful and clearly very old.
Worth visiting together with Nan Li garden. Next to Nan Li garden is the Chi Lin Nunnery. Best to enjoy both places together. Worth looking at the Lilypond and the various plants.
Chi Lin Nunnery, Hong Kong. Very quiet and nice place. It consists in two parts : the temple and the park.We visited these two areas and we really recommend.
Pretty but not much to do. Beautiful grounds but not much to occupy your time once you arrive. Somewhat disappointing after trekking over in the heat.

Worth going!. This does not seem to be the most popular tourist attraction in Hong Kong, or at least at the time when we visited there were like 2 other tourists. However, you can feel the Buddhism there and probably get that enlightment everyone is talking about. Silent, but you can feel the mood.
Serene. A wonderfully serene place to visit. Made entirely of wood (and apparently no nails), it's not exactly ancient - it was built in 1998! The Lotus ponds in front of the Nunnery are gorgeous.

Tranquil escape from Hong Kong city. A really unique and interesting place to visit - the architecture and feel of the Nunnery is fantastic, it is a really relaxing place to come to as a break from the centre of Hong Kong. The different rooms and sections of the Nunnery are spectacular, especially the decoration of the different statues. A really interesting day out.
Beautiful. Underrated.. Great for photos and strolling around. Beautiful place. Worth coming to if you have extra time. Nan Lian Garden is just beside it.

Connecting with nature. This breathtaking nunnery is surrounded by massive and grey buildings.
Even though, it encloses a deep sense of peace and makes you feel connected with nature.
The gardens and pounds within its walls are really awesome.

Nice and relaxing spot in Hong Kong. Next to Nan Lian garden. Best way to get here is to take MTR to Diamond Hill and walk from there. Nice and tranquil surroundings with views of nearby skyscrapers suggesting you are actually in Hong Kong. The grounds are fairly small with water ponds with water lilies and temple (as well as the actual nunnery) but it is a nice trip when in Hong Kong.

Lovely buildings on the hill. It's actually better than the Nan Lian garden due to being further from, and above, the main road, as well as being backed by wooded hills, which amplifies the beauty of the buildings and the simple garden. Both sites are just a few minutes from the MTR.

Must visit. . Next to the Nan Lian garden. This nunnery is a quite place amidst the hustle of the city. It will take you to a different world altogether. Photography is allowed only ag selective places. But the nunnery isn't to be missed. Spend some time here and you will love it. It has free entry. You also have a souvenir shop which is quite expensive.

An oasis of calm. We needed two changes on the MTR from Wan Chai, but it was well worth it, the peace and solitude surrounded by the Hong Kong madness is truly quite remarkable. The lotus water gardens with the most beautiful colours gave the nunnery a tranquility that needs to be enjoyed. The various rooms with religious artifacts were very interested and exquisite.It is free to enter but a donation is the least you can do.If you do visit do not miss the Nan Lian Gardens over the road. Fabulous

Night life in a different style. Chi Lin serves vegetarian food and they have a nice garden affording space for a leisurely walk before or after meal. Many come just for a visit of the garden, which is quite nicely done in the midst of the concrete jungle in the Diamond Hill area. We made a booking for dinner, which is highly recommended, especially for lunch time. I am not a fan of vegetarian food but the meal we had was interesting and fine. We had a table on the 1/F and the view outside was quite pleasant.
Restful for a chill walk. Restful for a chill walk attraction when combined with the adjoining gardens. However, you are still in a city, so definitely a city attraction.

A quiet and beautiful oasis in Hong Kong. If you need to relax from the intensive life of central Hong Kong this is a very quiet and relaxing place. You find some amazing Bonsai trees here together with beautiful gardens and buildings. This is a place for meditation or just strolling around and relaxi from the intebse city life of Hong kong.

Tranquil Sunday Outing. Due to the cadence of my work trips I only get one day of R&R in HK once very 3-4 months. This has been going on for the past 4 years. It took that long to find this gem of an excursion. Defiantly worth a trip if you are into architecture, craftsmanship, tranquility, Chinese history/culture and quite reflection. Very easy to get to on the metro as it is less than a 5min walk from the the Dimond hill Station. I started at the Nunnery then walked across the bridge to the adjacent park. It was a rainy Sunday afternoon so the park was not swarmed with people. From what I hear it can get pretty busy. Thankfully that was not the case on the day I went. In the garden I came to a beautiful tea house where I stopped for an hr or so and enjoyed some refreshments while taking in the scenery. Don't miss the pavilion where there is an exhibit explaining how these buildings are built. Ancient Chinese architectural technique using no metal fasteners. I rounded out the day with a 2hr massage, dinner at Din Tai Fung and a glass of whisky at the Peninsula Hotel. One of the best days in HK so far!!
your own corner of peace in Hongkong. Calm and soothing experience. It is just across Nan Lian garden. Beautiful idols of Buddhist Saints.

A hidden treasure in the middle of a busy city. Totally worth an hour or two to wonder around the gardens and slow down to experience the Nunnery. A totally unexpected spot of serenity in the middle of a very busy city.

Tang dynasty architectural style. The temple style is dated back to the Tang Dynasty (AD618-907) but the temple was rebuilt in 1990s. Apart from the architecture, you can also see spectacular pots of special pine and different forms of rock. Next is the Nan Lian Garden with a golden tower surrounded by an artificial lake.http://hkindependent-traveller-croatia.blogspot.hk/2015/04/chi-lin-nunnery-and-nan-lian-garden.html

A step back in time. The buildings, lotus ponds and bonsai were in perfect symmetry. It was tranquil to walk around in the temple admiring the statues of various gods with its background music of amitabha chanting. 8 min walk from Diamond Hill MTR.
Very peaceful!. Well worth a visit! This is a very tranquil place with beautiful gardens. Include among the sites to be visited in Kowloon.

Hong Kong contrast just an MRT away. What can I say, I'm blown away everytime I visit. Whether you're there as a tourist or you want a spiritual journey of some sort, this is a must visit, a sharp break from the glass and concrete of HKG. Very, very accessible from the Diamond Hill MRT station, through the busy Hollywood Mall. Do continue your visit to the adjoining Nan Lian Gardens.

Diamond at Diamond Hill. The Chi Lin Nunnery is a peaceful oasis of spiritual calm amidst the drab reality of north Kowloon. It's an easy stroll from the Diamond Hill MTR and a wonderful treat to "lock and reload" between meetings, or at the start of - or end of the day. The beautifully landscaped gardens and exhibition buildings, the magnificent Tang Dynasty temple complex and the hillside location all meld into an awe inspiring experience, whether you are a Buddhist or not. Add to this a beautifully simple vegetarian restaurant, fronted by a waterfall, which serves delicious, MSG-free meals (sadly a rarity for Chinese vegetarian restaurants in Hong Kong) and you have a must visit destination, which, selfishly, I hope the big tour groups will manage to avoid.

A place of calm and beuty. This is a wonderful place of calm and tranquility. We got a taxi for from the center as it was easier and a tube back with no hassles. Ultimately its a set of temples and a garden but done to a very high standard and it makes a very good contrast to the rest of Hong Kong. Though tired the children enjoyed it.
The Nunnery. Yes, have a visit, 5 min walk from mtr train station.The nunnery is very quiet, with ponds and buildings, (built of wood, hunderds of years old) spent about 1 hour and worth the visit.

Serene nunnery. The nunnery is connected to Nan Lian garden across the highway by a concrete pedestrian bridge. The architecture of the nunnery is stunning and utilises wood interlocking techniques without the use of nails. It s one of the only buildings in Hong Kong built this way. Free entry into the courtyard of the temple and nunnery. There was also a gift shop located to the right operated by nuns selling various ornaments and food. Worth a visit

Wonderful Way to Cross Victoria Harbour. I only got to enjoy going on it my last night in Hong Kong, but I went from Kowloon to Victoria and back. Usually I use it for all my cross-Harbour travel, but this trip I used the MTR almost exclusively, because my hotel (ShangriLa Kowloon) was right by an MTR station, and the places I was visiting on Victoria were more easily accessible by MTR. BUT I LOVE STAR FERRY's First class! ;-)
It is just a park. If you do love park most, it is ok good.Otherwise, it is just a park, nothing special there.inside it, you can have some vegetarian type restaurant inside this park
No joss sticks allowed. Built in the style of the Tang Dynasty with wood and traditional Chinese architectural skills and well maintained, the nunnery provides you with a place to have inner peace.
Tranquility. Opposite Nan Lian Gardens a beatuful tranquil place so clean and restful as well as wonderful to see

Peaceful place. Amazing wooden work in the buildings ,very different from other Chinese temples I visited,beautiful,it worth the visit!!!
